titles: An appeal to the House of Commons, desiring their ansvver: vvhether the common-people shall have the quiet enjoyment of the commons and waste land; or whether they shall be under the will of lords of mannors still. Occasioned by an arrest, made by Thomas Lord Wenman, Ralph Verny Knight, and Richard Winwood Esq; upon the author hereof, for a trespass, in digging upon the common-land at Georges Hill in Surrey. / By Gerrard Winstanly, Iohn Barker, and Thomas Star, in the name of all the poor oppressed in the land of England.
author: Winstanley, Gerrard, b. 1609.
Barker, John, 17th cent.
Star, Thomas.
England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.
notes: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Great Britain --  Politics and government --  1649-1660 --  Early works to 1800.
